title: AWS Advanced Networking to Azure Networking: Enterprise Network Design and Architecture
description: Master advanced network design by implementing enterprise-grade network architectures with AWS advanced networking services and migrating to Azure networking equivalents with global connectivity, hybrid networking, and multi-region designs.
learningObjectives: Design enterprise network architectures with AWS Transit Gateway and Azure Virtual WAN
Implement advanced hybrid connectivity with Direct Connect and ExpressRoute
Build multi-region network designs with global connectivity and traffic optimization
Create network segmentation and micro-segmentation strategies for security
Design scalable DNS and content delivery architectures across regions
Implement advanced load balancing and traffic management solutions
prerequisites: Strong understanding of networking fundamentals (OSI model, TCP/IP, routing, switching)
Experience with AWS VPC and Azure Virtual Network concepts
Familiarity with enterprise networking concepts and hybrid cloud architectures
Knowledge of network security principles and best practices
businessScenario: GlobalTech Enterprise operates across multiple continents with complex networking requirements including hybrid cloud connectivity, multi-region deployments, strict security requirements, and high-performance applications. Their network architecture team needs to design scalable, secure, and high-performance network solutions that support business growth, regulatory compliance, and optimal user experience across AWS and Azure platforms.

troubleshooting.issue: Complex routing issues and BGP convergence problems in large-scale networks
troubleshooting.solution: Implement proper BGP communities and route filtering, use route dampening, configure proper AS-PATH prepending, implement route reflectors, and use comprehensive routing monitoring

troubleshooting.issue: Network performance bottlenecks and latency issues in global deployments
troubleshooting.solution: Implement traffic engineering and QoS policies, use Global Accelerator and Front Door, optimize DNS resolution, implement edge caching, and use performance monitoring

troubleshooting.issue: Security policy conflicts and network segmentation complexity
troubleshooting.solution: Implement hierarchical security policies, use automated policy validation, create clear segmentation boundaries, implement policy versioning, and use network simulation
